meanings.definition: A member of the majority faction of the Russian Social Democratic Party, which seized power in the October Revolution of 1917.
meanings.sent1: The bolshevik led the revolution with determination.
meanings.sent2: Many bolsheviks gathered to discuss their plans for change.
meanings.sent3: The bolshevik walked into the meeting wearing a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like a bolshevik storm, sweeping through the old ways.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bolshevik raising the flag became iconic.

meanings.definition: A supporter of the Bolsheviks or their policies.
meanings.sent1: She proudly declared herself a bolshevik in the political rally.
meanings.sent2: The bolsheviks celebrated their victory in the square.
meanings.sent3: The bolshevik joked that even the pigeons supported their cause.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the cause made him a true bolshevik in spirit.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered for the bolsheviks, united in their beliefs.
